title: Authors and Citation
text: Wang Z (2023). shidashi: Shiny Dashboard Template System. https://dipterix.org/shidashi/, https://github.com/dipterix/shidashi.
code: @Manual{,   title = {shidashi: A Shiny Dashboard Template System},   author = {Zhengjia Wang},   year = {2023},   note = {https://dipterix.org/shidashi/, https://github.com/dipterix/shidashi}, }

title: A Shiny Dashboard Template System
text: goal shidashi provide framework R-shiny templates, especially dashboard applications.  Default template (using AdminLTE) provides two themes: light vs dark

title: A Shiny Dashboard Template System
text: can install released version shidashi CRAN :
code: install.packages("shidashi")

title: A Shiny Dashboard Template System
text: demo app requires install following extra packages installed packages, run following command R:
code: install.packages(c("ggExtra", "rmarkdown")) library(shidashi) project <- file.path(tools::R_user_dir('shidashi', which = "data"), "AdminLTE3")  # `use_template` only needs to be called once use_template(project) render(project)

title: A Shiny Dashboard Template System
text: start shidashi project, open RStudio menu navigation bar: File > New Project… > New Directory > Shidashi Shiny Template (*) _*might need scroll find template option_. Please enter project information accordingly. default, Github user dipterix, theme AdminLTE3, lead default template.

title: A Shiny Dashboard Template System
text: want start bare-bone template, change theme option AdminLTE3-bare.

title: A Shiny Dashboard Template System
text: typical shidashi project following file structure:
code: <project root_path> ├─modules/ │ └─<module ID>           - Module folder; folder name is module ID │   ├─R                   - Module functions shared across UI and server │   ├─module-ui.html      - Module HTML template │   └─server.R            - Module-level server function ├─R/                      - Common functions shared across modules ├─views/                  - Small snippets (see `?include_view` function) ├─www/                    - Static files: css, js, img, ... ├─index.html              - Template for homepage ├─modules.yaml            - Module label, order, icon, badge.. └─server.R                - Root server function, usually no modification is required

title: A Shiny Dashboard Template System
text: Create Github repository name shidashi-templates. Add folders named themes. people can install themes templates RStudio. easy start fork repository.

title: Generates an 'accordion' tab-set — accordion
text: Generates 'accordion' tab-set one tab expanded time. feature experimental bugs situations. Please use risk.

title: Generates an 'accordion' tab-set — accordion
code: accordion(   ...,   id = rand_string(prefix = "accordion-"),   class = NULL,   style_header = NULL,   style_body = NULL,   env = parent.frame(),   extras = list(),   root_path = template_root() )  accordion_operate(   id,   itemId,   item_title,   method = c("expand", "collapse", "toggle"),   session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain() )

title: Generates an 'accordion' tab-set — accordion
text: ... 'accordion' items, generated accordion_item id element id, must unique class additional 'HTML' class style_header additional 'CSS' styles header style_body additional 'CSS' styles content body env environment evaluate ... extras key-value pairs overrides parameters accordion_item root_path see template_root itemId accordion_item id item_title accordion_item title, item id specified, title ignored method operation, choices 'expand' (default), 'collapse', 'toggle' session shiny session

title: Generates an 'accordion' tab-set — accordion
text: 'shiny.tag.list' 'HTML' tags

title: Generates an 'accordion' tab-set — accordion
code: if(interactive()) {    library(shiny)   library(shidashi)    accordion(     id = "input-set",     accordion_item(       title = "Input Group A",       textInput("input_1", "Input 1"),       collapsed = FALSE,       footer = "Anim pariatur cliche reprehenderit dolor brunch."     ),     accordion_item(       title = "Input Group B",       textInput("input_2", "Input 2"),       footer = actionButton("btn1", "OK"),       collapsed = FALSE     )   ) }

title: 'Accordion' items — accordion_item
text: 'Accordion' items

title: 'Accordion' items — accordion_item
code: accordion_item(   title,   ...,   footer = NULL,   class = "",   collapsed = TRUE,   parentId = rand_string(prefix = "accordion-"),   itemId = rand_string(prefix = "accordion-item-"),   style_header = NULL,   style_body = NULL,   root_path = template_root() )

title: 'Accordion' items — accordion_item
text: title character title show header ... body content footer footer element, hidden NULL class class item collapsed whether collapsed beginning parentId parent accordion id itemId item id style_header, style_body 'CSS' style item header body root_path see template_root

title: 'Accordion' items — accordion_item
text: 'shiny.tag.list' 'HTML' tags

title: Add or remove 'HTML' class from 'RAVE' application — add-remove-html-class
text: selector 'CSS' selector class class add remove selected elements session shiny session

title: Add or remove 'HTML' class from 'RAVE' application — add-remove-html-class
text: value returned

title: Add or remove 'HTML' class from 'RAVE' application — add-remove-html-class
code: server <- function(input, output, session){    # Add class `hidden` to element with ID `elemid`   add_class("#elemid", "hidden")    # Remove class `hidden` from element with class `shiny-input-optional`   remove_class(".shiny-input-optional", "hidden") }

text: root_path root path website project; see template_settings settings_file settings file containing module information shared_id shared identification session synchronize inputs; assigned internally.

title: Generates badge icons — as_badge
text: Usually used along card, card2, card_tabset. See tools parameters functions accordingly.

title: Generates badge icons — as_badge
code: as_badge(badge = NULL)

title: Generates badge icons — as_badge
text: badge characters, "shiny.tag" object NULL

title: Generates badge icons — as_badge
text: 'HTML' tags

title: Generates badge icons — as_badge
text: badge NULL empty, as_badge returns empty strings. badge "shiny.tag" object, 'HTML' class 'right' 'badge' appended. badge string, follow syntax "message|class". text "|" badge message, text "|" becomes class string.

title: Generates badge icons — as_badge
code: # Basic usage as_badge("New") #> New # Add class `bg-red` and `no-padding` as_badge("New|bg-red no-padding") #> New

title: Card-like 'HTML' element — card
text: Card-like 'HTML' element

title: Card-like 'HTML' element — card
code: card(   title,   ...,   footer = NULL,   tools = NULL,   inputId = NULL,   class = "",   class_header = "",   class_body = "",   class_foot = "",   style_header = NULL,   style_body = NULL,   start_collapsed = FALSE,   resizable = FALSE,   root_path = template_root() )  card2(   title,   body_main,   body_side = NULL,   footer = NULL,   tools = NULL,   inputId = NULL,   class = "",   class_header = "",   class_body = "min-height-400",   class_foot = "",   style_header = NULL,   style_body = NULL,   start_collapsed = FALSE,   root_path = template_root() )  card2_open(inputId, session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())  card2_close(inputId, session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())  card2_toggle(inputId, session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())  card_operate(   inputId,   title,   method,   session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain() )

title: Card-like 'HTML' element — card
text: title title card ... body content card footer footer card; hidden footer=NULL tools list tools badges displayed top-right corner, generated as_badge card_tool inputId id card class 'HTML' class entire card class_header 'HTML' class card header class_body 'HTML' class card body class_foot 'HTML' class card footer style_header 'CSS' style header style_body 'CSS' style body start_collapsed whether card starts collapsed resizable whether card body can resized vertically; notice true, default padding body zero root_path see template_root body_main, body_side used card2, body content front back sides card session shiny session domain method action expand, minimize, remove cards; choices "collapse", "expand", "remove", "toggle", "maximize", "minimize", "toggleMaximize"

title: Card-like 'HTML' element — card
text: 'HTML' tags

title: Card-like 'HTML' element — card
code:
library(shiny) library(shidashi) # Used for example only ns <- I session <- MockShinySession$new() # -------------- Basic usage ------------- card( title = "Badges", div( class = "padding-20", p( "Add badges to the top-right corder. ", "Use \"|\" to indicate the badge classes; ", "for example: \"badge-info\", \"badge-warning\"..." ), hr(), p( "Use `resizable = TRUE` to make card resizable." ) ), tools = list( as_badge("New|badge-info"), as_badge("3|badge-warning") ), class_body = "height-300", resizable = TRUE ) #>
#>
#>

Badges

#> #>
#> New #> 3 #>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>

#> Add badges to the top-right corder. #> Use "|" to indicate the badge classes; #> for example: "badge-info", "badge-warning"... #>

#>
#>

Use `resizable = TRUE` to make card resizable.

#>
#>
#>
#> #>
#> # ---------------- With tools ----------------- card( title = "Default Tools", plotOutput( ns("card_defaulttool_plot"), height = "100%" ), tools = list( card_tool( widget = "link", href = "https://github.com/dipterix" ), card_tool(widget = "collapse"), card_tool(widget = "maximize") ), class_body = "height-300", resizable = TRUE ) #>
#>
#>

Default Tools

#> #>
#> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#> #>
#> # -------------- Card2 example -------------- card2( title = "Card2 Example", body_main = plotOutput( outputId = ns("card2_plot"), height = "100%" ), body_side = fluidRow( column( 6L, textInput( ns("card2_plot_title"), "Plot title" ) ), column( 6L, sliderInput( ns("card2_plot_npts"), "# of points", min = 1, max = 100, value = 10, step = 1, round = TRUE ) ) ), tools = list( card_tool(widget = "link", href = "https://github.com/dipterix"), card_tool(widget = "collapse"), card_tool(widget = "maximize") ), class_body = "height-300" ) #>
#>
#>

Card2 Example

title: Generates a set of card panels — card_tabset
code: card_tabset(   ...,   inputId = rand_string(prefix = "tabset-"),   title = NULL,   names = NULL,   active = NULL,   tools = NULL,   footer = NULL,   class = "",   class_header = "",   class_body = "",   class_foot = "" )

title: Generates a set of card panels — card_tabset
text: ... 'HTML' tags; tag placed card inputId id card-set, must start letters title title card-set names title tabs active title active load tools list tools badges generated card_tool as_badge footer footer element card-set class 'HTML' class card-set class_header, class_body, class_foot additional 'HTML' class card header, body, footer accordingly

title: Generates a set of card panels — card_tabset
text: 'HTML' tags

title: Generates a set of card panels — card_tabset
code:
library(shiny) library(shidashi) # Fake session to operate on card_tabset without shiny session <- MockShinySession$new() card_tabset( inputId = "card_set", title = "Cardset with Tools", `Tab 1` = p("Tab content 1"), class_body = "height-500", tools = list( as_badge( "New|badge-success" ), card_tool( widget = "collapse" ), card_tool( widget = "maximize" ) ) ) #>
#>
#>
    #>
  • #>

    Cardset with Tools

    #>
    • #>
  • #> Tab 1 #>
    • #>
  • #>
    #> New #> #> #> #> #> #> #>
    #>
    • #>
#>
#>
#>
#>
#>

Tab content 1

#>
#>
#>
#>
card_tabset_insert( inputId = "card_set", title = "Tab 2", p("New content"), session = session ) card_tabset_activate( inputId = "card_set", title = "Tab 1", session = session ) card_tabset_remove( inputId = "card_set", title = "Tab 2", session = session )

text: functions execute session$sendCustomMessage return whatever value generated function; usually nothing.

title: Generates small icon widgets — card_tool
text: icons cane displayed header line within accordion, card, card2, card_tabset. See examples.

title: Generates small icon widgets — card_tool
code: card_tool(   inputId = NULL,   title = NULL,   widget = c("maximize", "collapse", "remove", "flip", "refresh", "link", "custom"),   icon,   class = "",   href = "#",   target = "_blank",   start_collapsed = FALSE,   ... )

title: Generates small icon widgets — card_tool
text: inputId button id, necessary widget "custom" title tip message show mouse cursor hovers icon widget icon widget type; choices "maximize", "collapse", "remove", "flip", "refresh", "link", "custom"; see 'Details' icon icon use unsatisfied default ones class additional class tool icons href, target used widget "link", open external website; default open new tab start_collapsed used widget "collapse", whether card start collapsed ... passed tag attributes

title: Generates small icon widgets — card_tool
text: 'HTML' tags included tools parameter accordion, card, card2, card_tabset

title: Generates small icon widgets — card_tool
text: 7 widget types: "maximize" allow elements maximize full-screen "collapse" allow elements collapse "remove" remove card card2 "flip" used together flip_box, allow card body flip "refresh" refresh shiny outputs "link" open hyper-link pointing external websites "custom" turn icon actionButton. case, inputId must specified.

title: Generates outputs that can be written to clipboards with one click — clipboardOutput

title: Generate 'HTML' tags with 'flex' layout — flex_container
text: ... flex_container, elements flex_item; flex_item, ... shiny 'HTML' tags style additional 'CSS' style containers inner items direction, wrap, justify, align_box, align_content 'CSS' styles 'flex' containers size numerical relative size item; ignored flex provided order, align, flex CSS' styles 'flex' items class, .class class add elements

title: Generate 'HTML' tags with 'flex' layout — flex_container
text: 'HTML' tags

title: Generate 'HTML' tags with 'flex' layout — flex_container
code: x <- flex_container(   style = "position:absolute;height:100vh;top:0;left:0;width:100%",   flex_item(style = 'background-color:black;'),   flex_item(style = 'background-color:red;') ) # You can view it via `htmltools::html_print(x)`

what: An 'HTML' container that can flip — flip_box
title: An 'HTML' container that can flip — flip_box
text: 'HTML' container can flip

title: An 'HTML' container that can flip — flip_box
code: flip_box(   front,   back,   active_on = c("click", "click-front", "manual"),   inputId = NULL,   class = NULL )  flip(inputId, session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())

title: An 'HTML' container that can flip — flip_box
text: front 'HTML' elements show front back 'HTML' elements show box flipped active_on condition box flipped; choices 'click': flip double-click sides; 'click-front': flip front face double-clicked; 'manual': manually flip R code (see {flip(inputId)} function) inputId element 'HTML' id; must specified active_on 'click' class 'HTML' class session shiny session; default current active domain

title: An 'HTML' container that can flip — flip_box
text: flip_box returns 'HTML' tags; flip called shiny session, returns nothing

title: An 'HTML' container that can flip — flip_box
code:
# More examples are available in demo library(shiny) library(shidashi) session <- MockShinySession$new() flip_box(front = info_box("Side A"), back = info_box("Side B"), inputId = 'flip_box1') #>
#>
#>
#> #> #> #>
#> Side B #> #>
#>
#> #>
#>
#> #> #> #>
#> Side A #> #>
#>
#> #>
#>
#>
flip('flip_box1', session = session)

title: Get re-formatted R expressions in characters — format_text_r
code: s <- format_text_r(print(local({a<-1;a+1}))) cat(s) #> print( #>   local( #>     { #>       a <- 1 #>       a + 1 #>     } #>   ) #> )  x <- info_box("Message", icon = "cogs") s <- format_text_r(get_construct_string(x),                    width.cutoff = 15L, quoted = TRUE) cat(s) #> info_box( #>   "Message", icon = "cogs" #> )

title: The 'JavaScript' tunnel — javascript-tunnel
text: 'JavaScript' tunnel

title: The 'JavaScript' tunnel — javascript-tunnel
code: register_session_id(   session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain(),   shared_id = NULL,   shared_inputs = NA )  register_session_events(session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())  get_theme(event_data, session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())  get_jsevent(   event_data,   type,   default = NULL,   session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain() )

title: The 'JavaScript' tunnel — javascript-tunnel
text: session shiny reactive domain shared_id shared id session, usually automatically set shared_inputs input names share /sessions event_data reactive value list returned register_session_events type event type; see 'Details' default default value type missing

title: The 'JavaScript' tunnel — javascript-tunnel
text: register_session_id returns list function control "sharing" inputs shiny sessions shared_id. register_session_events returns reactive value list reflects session state. get_jsevent returns events fired shidashi.broadcastEvent 'JavaScript'. get_theme returns list theme, foreground, background color.

title: The 'JavaScript' tunnel — javascript-tunnel
text: register_session_id used module server function. registers shared_id private_id session. sessions shared_id can synchronize inputs, specified shared_inputs even different browser tabs. register_session_events read session events 'JavaScript' passively update information. event fired shidashi.broadcastEvent 'JavaScript' available reactive value. get_jsevent provides convenient way read events provided right event types. get_theme special get_jsevent event type "theme.changed". Function register_session_id register_session_events called beginning server functions. can called multiple times safely. Function get_jsevent get_theme called reactive contexts (observe, observeEvent).

title: The 'JavaScript' tunnel — javascript-tunnel
code: # shiny server function  library(shiny) server <- function(input, output, session){   sync_tools <- register_session_id(session = session)   event_data <- register_session_events(session = session)    # if you want to enable syncing. They are suspended by default   sync_tools$enable_broadcast()   sync_tools$enable_sync()    # get_theme should be called within reactive context   output$plot <- renderPlot({     theme <- get_theme(event_data)     mar(bg = theme$background, fg = theme$foreground)     plot(1:10)   })  }

title: Obtain the module information — module_info
text: Obtain module information

title: Obtain the module information — module_info
code: module_info(root_path = template_root(), settings_file = "modules.yaml")  load_module(   root_path = template_root(),   request = list(QUERY_STRING = "/"),   env = parent.frame() )

title: Obtain the module information — module_info
text: root_path root path website project settings_file settings file containing module information request 'HTTP' request string env environment load module variables

title: Obtain the module information — module_info
text: data frame following columns contain module information: id module id, folder name order display order side-bar group group menu name applicable, otherwise NA label readable label displayed side-bar icon icon displayed ahead label, passed as_icon badge badge text displayed following module label, passed as_badge url relative 'URL' address module.

title: Obtain the module information — module_info
text: module files stored modules/ folder project. folder names module id. Within folder, one "server.R", R/, "module-ui.html". R/ folder stores R code files generate variables, available two files. variables, along built-ins, used render "module-ui.html". built-functions ns shiny name-space function; used generate id inputs outputs. strategy avoids conflict id effectively. .module_id variable module id module_title function returns module label "server.R" access code R/ well. Therefore highly recommended write 'UI' component side--side corresponding server functions call server functions "server.R".

title: Obtain the module information — module_info
code: library(shiny) module_info() #>          id group        label   icon      badge                url #> 1 module_id    NA Module Label circle New|bg-red /?module=module_id  # load master module load_module() #> $environment #> <environment: 0x55aa006a96e8> #>  #> $has_module #> [1] FALSE #>  #> $root_path #> [1] "/home/runner/.local/share/R/shidashi/AdminLTE3-bare" #>  #> $template_path #> [1] "/home/runner/.local/share/R/shidashi/AdminLTE3-bare/index.html" #>  #> $module #> $module$id #> NULL #>  #> $module$server #> function (input, output, session, ...)  #> { #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55aa008e7f18> #> <environment: 0x55aa008ebf88> #>  #> $module$template_path #> NULL #>  #>   # load specific module module_data <- load_module(   request = list(QUERY_STRING = "/?module=module_id")) env <- module_data$environment  if(interactive()){  # get module title env$module_title()  # generate module-specific shiny id env$ns("input1")  # generate part of the UI env$ui()  }

title: The 'Bootstrap' notification — notification

title: The 'Bootstrap' notification — notification
code: show_notification(   message,   title = "Notification!",   subtitle = "",   type = c("default", "info", "warning", "success", "danger", "white", "dark"),   close = TRUE,   position = c("topRight", "topLeft", "bottomRight", "bottomLeft"),   autohide = TRUE,   fixed = TRUE,   delay = 5000,   icon = NULL,   collapse = "",   session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain(),   class = NULL,   ... )  clear_notifications(class = NULL, session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())

title: The 'Bootstrap' notification — notification
text: message notification body content, can 'HTML' tags title, subtitle title subtitle notification type type notification; can "default", "info", "warning", "success", "danger", "white", "dark" close whether allow users close notification position notification ; choices "topRight", "topLeft", "bottomRight", "bottomLeft" autohide whether automatically hide notification fixed whether position fixed delay integer millisecond hide notification autohide=TRUE icon icon title collapse message character vector, collapse string session shiny session domain class extra class notification, can used style purposes, clear_notifications close specific notification types. ... options; see https://adminlte.io/docs/3.1//javascript/toasts.html#options

title: The 'Bootstrap' notification — notification
text: functions used shiny reactive contexts. messages sent shiny 'JavaScript' interface nothing returned.

title: The 'Bootstrap' notification — notification
code: if (FALSE) {  # the examples must run in shiny reactive context  show_notification(   message = "This validation process has finished. You are welcome to proceed.",   autohide = FALSE,   title = "Success!",   subtitle = "type='success'",   type = "success" )  show_notification(   message = "This notification has title and subtitle",   autohide = FALSE,   title = "Hi there!",   subtitle = "Welcome!",   icon = "kiwi-bird",   class = "notification-auto" )  # only clear notifications with class "notification-auto" clear_notifications("notification-auto")  }

title: Progress bar in shiny dashboard — progressOutput
text: outputId element id progress ... extra elements top progress bar description descriptive message progress bar width width progress class progress class, default "bg-primary" value initial value, ranging 0 100; default 0 size size progress bar; choices "md", "sm", "xs" expr R expression return named list value description env evaluate expr quoted whether expr quoted outputArgs list parameters progressOutput

title: Progress bar in shiny dashboard — progressOutput
text: progressOutput returns 'HTML' tags containing progress bars can rendered later via shiny_progress renderProgress. renderProgress returns shiny render functions internally.

title: Progress bar in shiny dashboard — progressOutput
code:
library(shiny) library(shidashi) progressOutput("sales_report_prog1", description = "6 days left!", "Add Products to Cart", span(class="float-right", "123/150"), value = 123/150 * 100) #>
#> Add Products to Cart #> 123/150 #>
#>
#>
#> 6 days left! #> #>
# server function server <- function(input, output, session, ...){ output$sales_report_prog1 <- renderProgress({ return(list( value = 140 / 150 * 100, description = "5 days left!" )) }) }

title: Wrapper of shiny progress that can run without shiny — shiny_progress
text: title title progress max max steps procedure ... passed initialization method Progress quiet whether progress needs quiet session shiny session domain shiny_auto_close whether close progress function exits log alternative log function outputId element id progressOutput, NULL use default shiny progress

title: Wrapper of shiny progress that can run without shiny — shiny_progress
text: list functions controls progress

title: Wrapper of shiny progress that can run without shiny — shiny_progress
code: {   progress <- shiny_progress("Procedure A", max = 10)   for(i in 1:10){     progress$inc(sprintf("Step %s", i))     Sys.sleep(0.1)   }   progress$close()  } #>  [Procedure A]: initializing...                                                   #>  [Procedure A]: Step 1 (1 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 2 (2 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 3 (3 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 4 (4 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 5 (5 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 6 (6 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 7 (7 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 8 (8 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 9 (9 out of 10)                                              #>  [Procedure A]: Step 10 (10 out of 10)                                            #>  Finished                                                                          if(interactive()){   library(shiny)    ui <- fluidPage(     fluidRow(       column(12, actionButton("click", "Click me"))     )   )    server <- function(input, output, session) {     observeEvent(input$click, {       progress <- shiny_progress("Procedure B", max = 10,                                  shiny_auto_close = TRUE)       for(i in 1:10){         progress$inc(sprintf("Step %s", i))         Sys.sleep(0.1)       }     })   }    shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: Download 'shidashi' templates from 'Github' — use_template
text: target project path

title: Download 'shidashi' templates from 'Github' — use_template
text: publish 'shidashi' template, create 'Github' repository called 'shidashi-templates', fork built-templates. theme sub-folder template repository. easy way use template project 'RStudio' project widget. 'RStudio' navigation bar, go "File" menu, click "New Project..." button, select "Create new project" option, find item creates 'shidashi' templates. Use widget set template directory.

title: shidashi 0.1.5
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-04 Fixed accordion card_tabset working properly inputId starts digits Updated templates used npm compile Session information now stores userData instead risky cache Ensured least template root directory available

title: shidashi 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-15 Fixed bug makes application fail launch Windows Added support evaluated expressions launching application, allowing actions setting global options loading data

title: shidashi 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-06 Allow modules hidden sidebar

title: shidashi 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-21 Fixed group name handled correctly factors Module URL respects domain now generated relative path Works rstudio-server now stable behavior flex_container Allow output (mainly plot text outputs) reset Fixed iframe height set correctly Enhanced 500 page print traceback, helping debug errors Added flex_break allow wrapping elements flex container Added remove_class remove HTML class string Allow set data-title cards

title: shidashi 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-11-17 Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
